description: The Static Analysis Engine subsystem is responsible for performing deep structural and relational analysis of source code across multiple programming languages. Its boundaries encompass all components involved in scanning projects, detecting languages, interacting with Language Server Protocol (LSP) servers, building code graphs, resolving references, and storing the comprehensive analysis results.

components.name: Static Analysis Orchestrator
components.description: Coordinates the entire static analysis workflow, from project scanning and language detection to LSP client initialization, analysis execution, and aggregation of results. It drives the overall analysis process, ensuring all steps are executed in the correct sequence.

components.name: Project Scanner & Language Detector
components.description: Scans the project repository to identify programming languages, collect basic code statistics, and detect language-specific configuration files (e.g., pom.xml, tsconfig.json). It provides the initial context for language-specific analysis.

components.name: Language Configuration Manager
components.description: Manages and provides configurations for various programming languages, including details required for LSP server initialization (e.g., server commands, supported file suffixes). It acts as a central registry for language-specific settings.

components.name: LSP Client Core
components.description: Establishes and manages generic communication with Language Server Protocol (LSP) servers, handling requests, notifications, and basic symbol/definition retrieval. It provides the foundational interface for interacting with any LSP-compliant server.

components.name: Language-Specific LSP Clients
components.description: Specializes the LSP Client Core for specific programming languages (e.g., Java, TypeScript/JavaScript). These clients manage their respective language servers (e.g., JDTLS, TSServer) and provide language-specific analysis capabilities, extracting detailed code information.

components.name: Call Graph Builder
components.description: Constructs call graphs from raw analysis data obtained from LSP clients, identifying relationships between functions, methods, and other code elements. It provides a structural view of code execution flow and dependencies.

components.name: Reference Resolver
components.description: Resolves ambiguous or incomplete code references across the codebase using various strategies, including file path matching, existing references, and potentially LLM-assisted resolution. Its goal is to improve the accuracy and completeness of the analysis data.

components.name: Static Analysis Results Store
components.description: Serves as a central repository for all static analysis outputs, storing structured data such as call graphs, class hierarchies, package dependencies, and resolved references. It provides methods for querying and retrieving this comprehensive analysis data.
